hints.label: thm-complete-variance-drift
hints.title: Complete Variance Drift Characterization for Cloning
hints.content:
6897: :label: thm-complete-variance-drift
6898: 
6899: The cloning operator $\Psi_{\text{clone}}$ induces the following drift on the variance components of the Lyapunov function:
6900: 
6901: **1. Positional Variance (Strong Contraction):**
6902: 
6903: $$
6904: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6905: $$
6906: 
6907: where $\kappa_x > 0$ is $N$-independent (from Keystone Principle).
6908: 
6909: **2. Velocity Variance (Bounded Expansion):**
6910: 
6911: $$
6912: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6913: $$
6914: 
6915: where $C_v < \infty$ is a state-independent constant.
6916: 
6917: **3. Total Internal Variance:**
6918: 
6919: $$
6920: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] = \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6921: $$

hints.label: proof-thm-complete-variance-drift
hints.content:
6926: :::{prf:proof}
6927: :label: proof-thm-complete-variance-drift
6928: **Proof.**
6929: 
6930: This result follows immediately by combining the two component drift inequalities established earlier in this chapter.
6931: 
6932: From {prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction` ({prf:ref}`thm-positional-variance-contraction`), we have:
6933: 
6934: $$
6935: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] \leq -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x
6936: $$
6937: 
6938: From {prf:ref}`thm-bounded-velocity-expansion-cloning` ({prf:ref}`thm-velocity-variance-bounded-expansion`), we have:
6939: 
6940: $$
6941: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \leq C_v
6942: $$
6943: 
6944: By linearity of expectation, the total internal variance drift is:
6945: 
6946: $$
6947: \begin{aligned}
6948: \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var}}] &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x} + \Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \\
6949: &= \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},x}] + \mathbb{E}_{\text{clone}}[\Delta V_{\text{Var},v}] \\
6950: &\leq (-\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + C_x) + C_v \\
6951: &= -\kappa_x V_{\text{Var},x} + (C_x + C_v)
6952: \end{aligned}
6953: $$
6954: 
6955: This establishes the claimed drift inequality for the total variance.

hints.label: rem-drift-constants-dependencies
hints.title: Constants and Parameter Dependencies
hints.content:
6983: :label: rem-drift-constants-dependencies
6984: 
6985: The drift constants have the following dependencies:
6986: 
6987: **Contraction rate $\kappa_x$:**
6988: - Increases with measurement quality (larger $\epsilon$ → better diversity detection)
6989: - Increases with cloning responsiveness (larger $p_{\max}$ and smaller $\varepsilon_{\text{clone}}$)
6990: - Independent of $N$ (N-uniformity from Keystone)
6991: 
6992: **Expansion bound $C_v$:**
6993: - Increases with $V_{\max}^2$ (larger velocity domain)
6994: - Increases with $\alpha_{\text{restitution}}$ (more elastic collisions)
6995: - Decreases toward zero as $\alpha_{\text{restitution}} \to 0$ (perfectly inelastic)
6996: - Independent of $N$
